snippet: The agreement, which is expected to close on Jan. 20, will allow the carmaker and the union to end months of negotiations over the value of the United Automobile Workers’ stake.
abstract: Fiat says it has reached agreement to take full ownership of Chrysler in $4.35 billion deal with United Automobile Workers retiree health care fund; agreement, which is expected to close on Jan 20, will allow carmaker and union to end months of negotiations over the value of United Automobile Workers’ stake.
lead_paragraph: The agreement, which is expected to close on Jan. 20, will allow the carmaker and the union to end months of negotiations over the value of the United Automobile Workers’ stake.

headline.main: Fiat, in Deal With Union, Will Buy Rest of Chrysler
headline.print_headline: Fiat, in Deal With Union, Will Buy Rest of Chrysler
